intro: Macrocarpaea dillonii, commonly known as the Dillon's macrocarpaea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
